label: 本朝文粋
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: A collection of Chinese poems (shi) and prose written by Japanese authors.　[詩]This is a collection of Chinese poems and Chinese prose in fourteen books (kan), including various types of Chinese literature ranging from poetry and biographies to sealed documents containing one's political opinions and usggestions (ikenfūji) and documents issued by the Great Council of State (dajōkanfu).  They were written by famous Japanese schoalrs of Chinese literature.  The compiler was Fujiwara Akihira (A, p. 324). [巻、意見封事、太政官符、藤原明衡]
